docs.snippet: There are too many unqualified voters and too many segments of the baseball world with no say in the process....
docs.lead_paragraph: There are too many unqualified voters and too many segments of the baseball world with no say in the process.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column calls for change in Baseball Hall of Fame's induction process, claiming that there are too many unqualified voters and too many segments of the baseball world with no say in the process.

headline.seo: Baseball Hall of Fame Voting Process Must Change – Tyler Kepner
headline.main: A Voting Process Overdue for Reform
headline.print_headline: A Voting Process Overdue for Reform

docs.snippet: The Baseball Hall of Fame has a membership that includes multiple virulent racists, drunks, cheats, brawlers, drug users and at least one acknowledged sex addict....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Baseball Hall of Fame has a membership that includes multiple virulent racists, drunks, cheats, brawlers, drug users and at least one acknowledged sex addict.
docs.abstract: Roger Clemens and Barry Bonds have indisputable Hall of Fame statistics, but when 2013 balloting is announced, their association with performance-enhancing drugs could figure significantly; players linked to steroid use are often rejected from membership, despite fact that many past inductees have been racists, drunks, cheats and drug users.

headline.seo: Baseball Hall of Fame Has Always Made Room for Infamy
headline.main: Hall of Fame Has Always Made Room for Infamy
headline.print_headline: Hall of Fame Has Always Made Room For Infamy

docs.snippet: The Mets' lone player in the Baseball Hall of Fame, Tom Seaver, was was elected in 1992 with the highest vote percentage ever, 98.8, which is higher than Babe Ruth, higher than Joe DiMaggio, higher than Mickey Mantle....

docs.abstract: Washington Nationals reach two-year agreement to re-sign veteran first baseman Adam LaRoche, move that would most likely spring loose Michael Morse, outfielder, first baseman and right-handed hitter New York Yankees so covet; other MLB news noted.
